subject: fix the way we list changes that will not be included
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 17:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/list_changes.py'], 'message': "fix the way we list changes that will not be included

The git log range is apparently inclusive, which means when we try to
produce the list of changes that won't be in a release, we need to stop
at the parent of the target commit. Use ~1 to indicate the first parent
of the commit, which should always be the commit on the branch into
which a merge happened.

Change-Id: I7189b296a74445779c2227d63809d7d905cbb2db
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix the way we list changes that will not be included

The git log range is apparently inclusive, which means when we try to
produce the list of changes that won't be in a release, we need to stop
at the parent of the target commit. Use ~1 to indicate the first parent
of the commit, which should always be the commit on the branch into
which a merge happened.

Change-Id: I7189b296a74445779c2227d63809d7d905cbb2db
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
DeploymentGraph.update method added

Now it is possible to update deployment graph name
and tasks keeping the graph database ID intact.

DeploymentGraph.update and DeploymentGraph.create_for_model
methods are inroduced that allow to update or create graph.

Change-Id: I8170569d9283d226f53b5fb2879a5ff9ee7bb984
Implements: blueprint custom-graph-execution

commit_message:
Specify API version in Keystone url

For now Ceilometer working with API v2.0 by
default. There are issues to migrate on third API
version quickly, but with current configuration
"ceilometer-polling" doesn't work.

Change-Id: I250ba35e2612f8367b77265b4982cb2cb675dcdf
Closes-bug: #1560089

commit_message:
Add translation rule to delete ssh auth key from Magnum baymodel

Add a translation rule to ensure that users with existing templates will
not have them break when they update due to the 'ssh_authorized_key'
property having been removed from Magnum and hidden in Heat.

Change-Id: Id73bace93bfc2379e80777da7dc0c0bb059d6cd3
Related-Bug: #1560284

subject: Set UpdateIdentifier for upgrade converge, to prevent services down
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-24 18:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-pacemaker-converge.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_resource_restart.sh'], 'message': "Set UpdateIdentifier for upgrade converge, to prevent services down

We'd like to let the post puppet pacemaker controller services
restart to happen for the convergence step so set the
UpdateIdentifier. However also set the PackageUpdate to noop so the
yum_update.sh doesn't happen.

Since a full haproxy restart is expected, we no longer need the
systemctl reload added at Iae3bad745ecdf952a7a0314fe1375d07eb47c454
so remove that too.

Some more context at
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1321036

Co-Authored-By: marios <marios@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I31c2d97d68c97b435f63863fae2c89f18f99681d
"}]
commit_message:
Set UpdateIdentifier for upgrade converge, to prevent services down

We'd like to let the post puppet pacemaker controller services
restart to happen for the convergence step so set the
UpdateIdentifier. However also set the PackageUpdate to noop so the
yum_update.sh doesn't happen.

Since a full haproxy restart is expected, we no longer need the
systemctl reload added at Iae3bad745ecdf952a7a0314fe1375d07eb47c454
so remove that too.

Some more context at
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1321036

Co-Authored-By: marios <marios@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I31c2d97d68c97b435f63863fae2c89f18f99681d

subject: Use custom upstream mirrors in docker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 21:13:43.000000000', 'files': ['docker/module.mk', 'docker/fuel-centos-build/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Use custom upstream mirrors in docker

By default CentOS 7 docker image contains stock upstream mirrors
which is not possible to redefine. This patch eliminates this
limitation, by
 * removing all yum default upstream repos;
 * injecting in docker re-defined upstream mirror list which is
   used in RPM build chroot;
 * disabling all yum plugins.

Change-Id: I0c65f9062032782fc85e8a0f6406128490f4001d
Closes-bug: #1544119
'}]
commit_message:
Use custom upstream mirrors in docker

By default CentOS 7 docker image contains stock upstream mirrors
which is not possible to redefine. This patch eliminates this
limitation, by
 * removing all yum default upstream repos;
 * injecting in docker re-defined upstream mirror list which is
   used in RPM build chroot;
 * disabling all yum plugins.

Change-Id: I0c65f9062032782fc85e8a0f6406128490f4001d
Closes-bug: #1544119

subject: Add rubygems-deep_merge to package list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-21 17:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['elements/hiera/install.d/package-installs-hiera', 'elements/hiera/pkg-map'], 'message': 'Add rubygems-deep_merge to package list

The deep merge gem enables hiera to be able to merge hashes more
thoroughly than just the top level hashes. This is useful if we want
to add extra configurations in hiera that are already being
configured elsewhere in hiera (such as
keystone::config::keystone_config). Because currently what will
happen, for instance, with the keystone_config, is that it will take
the value of the hash that is defined later in the hierarchy.

Change-Id: Ib855a287491bf36e2609b354f804923f83ca2a1c
'}]
commit_message:
Add rubygems-deep_merge to package list

The deep merge gem enables hiera to be able to merge hashes more
thoroughly than just the top level hashes. This is useful if we want
to add extra configurations in hiera that are already being
configured elsewhere in hiera (such as
keystone::config::keystone_config). Because currently what will
happen, for instance, with the keystone_config, is that it will take
the value of the hash that is defined later in the hierarchy.

Change-Id: Ib855a287491bf36e2609b354f804923f83ca2a1c

commit_message:
Allow ironic driver to specify cafile

This patch adds a config option to the [ironic] group, allowing the
operator to specify a cacert file with which to connect to the
ironic-api service.

This corresponds with the way encrypted connections to other OpenStack
services are configured.

Change-Id: Ice1d6c3f6fc911c4f35fe0283e3d1e9dd8b0e1a7
Closes-bug: #1561796

subject: Respect "disk" kernel argument for better compatibility with the old ramdisk
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:41:24.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'ironic_python_agent/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/disk-param-8628940704ee1aff.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': 'Respect "disk" kernel argument for better compatibility with the old ramdisk

The default root device logic is different between IPA and the old ramdisk.
It results in user frustration when a mere rebuild moves their root device.
Actually, without cleaning it will lead to breakages, as cloud-init can't
reliably handle two config drive partitions and will use a random one.

This change makes IPA respect the "disk" argument which we still send.
Note that it only affects iSCSI drivers.

Change-Id: I3d28fdb171988ddb4f960cc4cb8bf2d55b70bf4f
Closes-Bug: #1554492
'}]
commit_message:
Respect "disk" kernel argument for better compatibility with the old ramdisk

The default root device logic is different between IPA and the old ramdisk.
It results in user frustration when a mere rebuild moves their root device.
Actually, without cleaning it will lead to breakages, as cloud-init can't
reliably handle two config drive partitions and will use a random one.

This change makes IPA respect the "disk" argument which we still send.
Note that it only affects iSCSI drivers.

Change-Id: I3d28fdb171988ddb4f960cc4cb8bf2d55b70bf4f
Closes-Bug: #1554492

Currently, neutron core resources (like net, subnet, port and subnetpool)
do not save time-stamps upon their creation and updation. This
information can be critical for debugging purposes.

This patch introduces a new extension called "timestamp" extending existing
the neutron core resources to allow their creation and modification times
to be record. Now this patch add this resource schema and the functions which
listen db events to add timestamp fields.

APIImpact
DocImpact: Neutron core resources now contain 'timestamp' fields like
           'created_at' and 'updated_at'

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-port-timestamp
'}]
commit_message:
Add timestamp for neutron core resources

Currently, neutron core resources (like net, subnet, port and subnetpool)
do not save time-stamps upon their creation and updation. This
information can be critical for debugging purposes.

This patch introduces a new extension called "timestamp" extending existing
the neutron core resources to allow their creation and modification times
to be record. Now this patch add this resource schema and the functions which
listen db events to add timestamp fields.

APIImpact
DocImpact: Neutron core resources now contain 'timestamp' fields like
           'created_at' and 'updated_at'

Change-Id: I24114b464403435d9c1e1e123d2bc2f37c8fc6ea
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-port-timestamp

commit_message:
Add searchlight-ui to searchlight

The Searchlight content from Horizon is moving from a patch to a
plugin.

At the horizon mitaka mid-cycle, we decided to move this to a plugin
for the Mitaka release. It was not possible to do so until
several patch dependencies merged on horizon master. Those
have now merged, so we are able to put this into its own repo.

Change-Id: I035c479102200cce38511482f433b030b066584d
Depends-On: I528537a525a54db3887688ab49b33983403dd2ca

commit_message:
enable output of metadata to a file

freezer-agent is now sending any backup-metadata to
the correct file or to stdout.
The following parameter now works as inteded:

  --metadata-out METADATA_OUT

Change-Id: I4e8cf9e80c702d2707eac7f539b2a97ca20a5052
Closes-Bug: #1549718

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-15 14:10:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/scheduler/dhcp_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Use context manager in bind NetworkDhcpAgent

In bind() method of dhcp_agent_scheduler for transaction was not
used context manager. This is not correct as if another exception
appear, not DBDuplicateEntry, that is caught, current transaction
will hang.

Current change is a simple refactoring, the code works as it does
prevously. Existing unit tests
* test_schedule_bind_network_multi_agent_fail_one,
* test_auto_schedule_network(Network already scheduled)
cover possible issues.

Closes-bug: #1557546

Change-Id: Ieb77738e065b997e0ab65afdc1f3bdbfb8f13fef
'}]
commit_message:
Use context manager in bind NetworkDhcpAgent

In bind() method of dhcp_agent_scheduler for transaction was not
used context manager. This is not correct as if another exception
appear, not DBDuplicateEntry, that is caught, current transaction
will hang.

Current change is a simple refactoring, the code works as it does
prevously. Existing unit tests
* test_schedule_bind_network_multi_agent_fail_one,
* test_auto_schedule_network(Network already scheduled)
cover possible issues.

Closes-bug: #1557546

commit_message:
Deploy failed if compute-vmware role used

If compute-vmware role used - deployment failed with error, because it
checks the existence of ovs bridge - 'br-int', which is not required/not
created for this role

Change-Id: I277170b2f8b3a10e7232884f37064f0430db30c4
Closes-bug: #1560516

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 00:30:00.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc'], 'message': 'Update cells blacklist regex for test_server_basic_ops

Tempest change 9bee3b92f1559cb604c8bd74dcca57805a85a97a
renamed a test in our blacklist so update the filter to
handle the old and new name.

The Tempest team is hesitant to revert the change so we
should handle it ourselves and eventually move to using
test uuids for our blacklist, but there might need to
be work in devstack-gate for that first.

Change-Id: Ibab3958044c21568d7fbbe0a298bb40bbbc20df3

commit_message:
Update cells blacklist regex for test_server_basic_ops

Tempest change 9bee3b92f1559cb604c8bd74dcca57805a85a97a
renamed a test in our blacklist so update the filter to
handle the old and new name.

The Tempest team is hesitant to revert the change so we
should handle it ourselves and eventually move to using
test uuids for our blacklist, but there might need to
be work in devstack-gate for that first.

Change-Id: Ibab3958044c21568d7fbbe0a298bb40bbbc20df3
Closes-Bug: #1562323
(cherry picked from commit e86b7fbb99de0c4cff6a9569f748bae1bde693a6)

As an implementation limitation, the 'api_version' decorator must be the
first decorator if applied on a method. This patch adds a pep8 check for

partial-bp: api-microversioning

commit_message:
Add hacking rule for api_version

As an implementation limitation, the 'api_version' decorator must be the
first decorator if applied on a method. This patch adds a pep8 check for
this to be enforced.

partial-bp: api-microversioning
Change-Id: Ib03ad91e492175d23dde8b3a30dae9a077baffb9

commit_message:
add new portal_port argument into iscsi.start_iscsi_target api

Currently we hardcode the iSCSI port to its default. With this
patch, we added new portal_port argument into iscsi.start_iscsi_target
api, cover both lio and tgt two iscsi target operations.

And for IPA client and driver code change, will commit more patch to
cover.

Change-Id: I6da20487ccba6cbac04d36b8643afdd1e3920b12
Partial-Bug: #1523829

commit_message:
Export path when puppet 4.

  This commit just exports PATH when testing against Puppet 4.

  Tests pass without this in some environments but is dependent on sudo
  configurations, to get tests passing in OpenStack Infra, this is
  required.

Change-Id: I04b486fb398aaad1a3333477995ec00a76b9da0b

commit_message:
Update tempest compute flavor_ref/flavor_ref_alt

After Ironic is moved to devstack plugin the tempest is always
executed before ironic devstack plugin. Unfortunatly there is no quick
way to change order.
This change introduce new function ironic_configure_tempest that is
called from Ironic's devstack plugin. It updated flavor_ref and
flavor_ref_alt compute tempest options.

Change-Id: I85a77dd2193bac0ea4bd4fc1985c82d9f598b06b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 15:06:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Fix resize of instance with deleted glance image

finish_migration() in the libvirt driver was attempting to resize an
image before checking that its backing file was present. This patch
re-orders these 2 operations. In doing so, we also have to resolve an
overloading of the 'disk_info' variable.

(cherry picked from commit db7fd539f261ea53f6c005478049424b9dae1543)

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

Minor context difference: local variable name changed in fake method.

Closes-Bug: #1546778

Change-Id: I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix resize of instance with deleted glance image

finish_migration() in the libvirt driver was attempting to resize an
image before checking that its backing file was present. This patch
re-orders these 2 operations. In doing so, we also have to resolve an
overloading of the 'disk_info' variable.

(cherry picked from commit db7fd539f261ea53f6c005478049424b9dae1543)

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

Minor context difference: local variable name changed in fake method.

Closes-Bug: #1546778

Change-Id: I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d

subject: Ensure vmutils honors the host argument
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 17:51:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Ensure vmutils honors the host argument

The VMUtils class init method ignores the host attribute, not
passing it to its super class.

For this reason, a local connection will be estabilished even if a
remote host is requested. This breaks live migration when having
disks attached.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I2d47308439d125ea9294e94c85e5403a01b1c50c
Closes-Bug: #1562982
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure vmutils honors the host argument

The VMUtils class init method ignores the host attribute, not
passing it to its super class.

For this reason, a local connection will be estabilished even if a
remote host is requested. This breaks live migration when having
disks attached.

This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I2d47308439d125ea9294e94c85e5403a01b1c50c
Closes-Bug: #1562982

commit_message:
Refresh the networks on ajax update

If using neutron, the ajax will query the last status from
nova which could be out of date, so any floating ips
added wont show up unless you refresh the whole page.

Change-Id: Iad1684d1a2fb677ee8850a98c8219794698722e3
Closes-Bug: 1505935
(cherry picked from commit b59ebcfaac67632520968353e61568c7aa637adc)

subject: Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}, {'_account_id': 13248, 'name': 'Wenzhi Yu', 'email': 'wenzhi_yu@163.com', 'username': 'yuywz'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 06:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/common/test_exceptions.py', 'openstackclient/common/exceptions.py', 'openstackclient/tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0

WebOb change https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230 changed
the way in which the error response body is formatted such that
it's no longer a nested dict. So we have to handle both the
old convention of an error message key to the response body error
dict and the new way with just the error body dict.

This was reported upstream:
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/issues/235

But given this was apparently implemented as a long-overdue change
in WebOb the behavior is not likely to change.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I099ee9a267e5fe3d1d02c1a2902742341ddfa5b2
Related-Bug: #1559072
"}]
commit_message:
Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0

WebOb change https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230 changed
the way in which the error response body is formatted such that
it's no longer a nested dict. So we have to handle both the
old convention of an error message key to the response body error
dict and the new way with just the error body dict.

This was reported upstream:
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/issues/235

But given this was apparently implemented as a long-overdue change
in WebOb the behavior is not likely to change.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I099ee9a267e5fe3d1d02c1a2902742341ddfa5b2
Related-Bug: #1559072

commit_message:
Allow deleting gateway interfaces on network topology

We didn't allow to delete a router_gateway interface from a router
in the network topology due to the checking being done
working only on normal interfaces.

Conflicts:
	horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.networktopology.js

Change-Id: I35f7fc7c0050e1441a740a110fb6f45ddec9371d
Closes-Bug: 1548224
(cherry picked from commit 58b905bf1cdb36fce0b3f2133c773c7eff1b315d)

commit_message:
Refactor the glance service group mapping

Add a glance_service_groups variable containers the container name,
service name and group name. In this way, we can remove lots of
duplicated lines.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Avoid cooldown when group size does not change

Cooldown behavior changed in commit:
50cc71e33c40a9e3be604b16f77d3c3cf030a63b

Restore the cooldown behavior so that when a group does not encounter
scaling activity, a cooldown period is not activated.

Closes-Bug: #1555748
Change-Id: Icf5df6a48afb9f56aa1c3f1622d33b9998aca39c
(cherry picked from commit 6c25e8302db02203fcb933e5b104507c83b6672c)

Update the script to find outdated constraints and update them. It

commit_message:
improve check_library_constraints.sh to edit the constraints file

Update the script to find outdated constraints and update them. It
depends on having a copy of the right branch of the requirements repo
already checked out, but it clones the other projects itself and then
edits the constraints file.

Change-Id: Idfacbc937adc7c70fe4505b47fe380e850f1899f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add some parameters in "Preview stack" and "Show stack details"

This patch set modified to add parameters: stack, link, creation_time.

+ Add parameters: stack, links, creation_time
in "Preview stack" response parameter. Which are missed.

+ Add parameters: stack, links, in "Show stack details"
response parameter. Which are missed.

subject: [OS-KSEC2 admin extension] Type of user_id parameter is wrong
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 08:26:35.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/common.ent', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/wadl/OS-KSS3-admin.wadl', 'api-ref/src/wadls/identity-api/src/v2.0/wadl/OS-KSEC2-admin.wadl'], 'message': '[OS-KSEC2 admin extension] Type of user_id parameter is wrong

This patch modified to fix type of user_id parameter. Which is wrong:
- List credentials, "Grant credential to user", "Get user credentials",
"Update user credentials", "Delete user credentials",
"List credentials by type": Type of user_id parameter is "capi:UUID",
this value is wrong. It should be changed "csapi:UUID".

Change-Id: Ie49162a3783f2d3550a1fc349532645833744f69
Closes-Bug: #1562671
'}]
commit_message:
[OS-KSEC2 admin extension] Type of user_id parameter is wrong

This patch modified to fix type of user_id parameter. Which is wrong:
- List credentials, "Grant credential to user", "Get user credentials",
"Update user credentials", "Delete user credentials",
"List credentials by type": Type of user_id parameter is "capi:UUID",
this value is wrong. It should be changed "csapi:UUID".

Change-Id: Ie49162a3783f2d3550a1fc349532645833744f69
Closes-Bug: #1562671

subject: Add "ip_address" to port response parameters.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 09:36:31.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/networking-api/src/common.ent'], 'message': 'Add "ip_address" to port response parameters.

Networking API v2.0:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2.html
Thi patch adds fixed_ips "ip_address" into port(s)'s response parameters
tables.
There is an existing "ip_address" parameter, however it belongs to
"allowed_address_pairs", not "fixed_ips".
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2.html#ports

Change-Id: I4e1cfddc2c90d33b818ddaf906539c7d8e2f2a1d
Closes-Bug: #1562741
'}]
commit_message:
Add "ip_address" to port response parameters.

Networking API v2.0:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2.html
Thi patch adds fixed_ips "ip_address" into port(s)'s response parameters
tables.
There is an existing "ip_address" parameter, however it belongs to
"allowed_address_pairs", not "fixed_ips".
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2.html#ports

Change-Id: I4e1cfddc2c90d33b818ddaf906539c7d8e2f2a1d
Closes-Bug: #1562741

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Closes-Bugs: #1529913

Change-Id: Icc01ce5fbd10880440cf75a2e0833394783464a0
Co-Authored-By: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

commit_message:
Using LOG.warning replace LOG.warn

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Closes-Bugs: #1529913

Change-Id: Icc01ce5fbd10880440cf75a2e0833394783464a0
Co-Authored-By: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

commit_message:
Fix update issues with autoscaling group

- Fix update stuck in  IN_PROGRESS if issued within
the cooldown period after CREATE_COMPLETE.

- Fix update stuck in IN_PROGRESS if issued when scaling
is happening.

Change-Id: I31074783f525ea811056e8df7ff46545e58075b5
Closes-Bug: #1559132

synchronized with some changes in murano-apps repo. It causes to
some issues in deployments

Add octavia experimental tempest job

As we are trying to setup tempest tests [1] using tempest-plugin
in Octavia, we want to add a new gate which it can be tested,
verified and run them against new patchsets.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/172199/

Methods 'get_horizon_url' and 'get_keystone_url' are not in use anymore
so must be removed. As a base they use (and only they are consumers of
it) 'get_end_point_ip' method which also must be removed. Tests for

commit_message:
Remove network manager's code not in use

Methods 'get_horizon_url' and 'get_keystone_url' are not in use anymore
so must be removed. As a base they use (and only they are consumers of
it) 'get_end_point_ip' method which also must be removed. Tests for
'get_end_point_ip' also removed.

Change-Id: Ifaae34dad3630db53754d457b12f1866c1293314
Closes-Bug: #1549760

commit_message:
Fix wrong type in common compute params

In common.ent DTD of compute API, fix wrong type of
DeallocateFloatingIpQueryParameters, ShowServerGroupQueryParameters,
DeleteServerGroupQueryParameters from 'String' to 'xsd:string'.

In createFloaingIP of Compute API ref, 'pool' params is missing type
of xsd:string

Change-Id: I20dbbf0490b2d87f2ebcb652f9d1fd95e18675c8
Closes-bug: #1562703

subject: Re-describe Network IP availability and usage stats response table
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 02:54:48.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/networking-api/src/common.ent'], 'message': 'Re-describe Network IP availability and usage stats response table

Networking API v2.0 extensions Network IP availability and usage
stats:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2-ext.html
This patch re-describes the response table include of required value
and many parameters type.
 + Change id, tenant_id types to csapi:UUID
 + Change total_ips, userd_ips to xsd:int
 + Change required values of all parameters to be true

Change-Id: I3077c70d68db1297d30c1b18c30c78709a1c2fd1
Closes-Bug: #1563140
'}]
commit_message:
Re-describe Network IP availability and usage stats response table

Networking API v2.0 extensions Network IP availability and usage
stats:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2-ext.html
This patch re-describes the response table include of required value
and many parameters type.
 + Change id, tenant_id types to csapi:UUID
 + Change total_ips, userd_ips to xsd:int
 + Change required values of all parameters to be true

Change-Id: I3077c70d68db1297d30c1b18c30c78709a1c2fd1
Closes-Bug: #1563140

subject: remove pypi publishing jobs for cloudkitty
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 20:06:58.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "remove pypi publishing jobs for cloudkitty

Cloudkitty is a service project, and we don't publish those to
PyPI. Having the publish-to-pypi template as well as
openstack-server-release-jobs results in duplicates of some of the jobs
running, especially the tarball and announcement email jobs.

Change-Id: I3bf9de9f362feafa18c8eb1d094e3fa69bb4c37b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
remove pypi publishing jobs for cloudkitty

Cloudkitty is a service project, and we don't publish those to
PyPI. Having the publish-to-pypi template as well as
openstack-server-release-jobs results in duplicates of some of the jobs
running, especially the tarball and announcement email jobs.

Change-Id: I3bf9de9f362feafa18c8eb1d094e3fa69bb4c37b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Wait for all cluster services before enabling quorum

This change adds cross depends on the task that enables quorum to wait
until all the services have been enabled. We are also adding a
dependency on the upload_cirros task to ensure all services are up on
the cluster prior to attempting finish the openstack configuration.

Change-Id: Ie29d2df050a3e067440ed5e4bd0c84d54df21356
Related-Bug: #1556068

commit_message:
Change umask 0002 to 0000 for vhostuser sockets

Due to unavailabitiy of libvirt-qemu group on netconfig time, it's
unable to set group correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1562985

subject: Move `keystone-coverage-db` job to check queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-24 20:30:47.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Move `keystone-coverage-db` job to check queue

It doesn't make sense that `keystone-coverage-db` is in the
post queue since the only time it would be looked at is after
the patch merges.  This patch moves it to the check queue.

Change-Id: I6b91e2e8817998b3955738b74585b7978375a0d5
"}]
commit_message:
Move `keystone-coverage-db` job to check queue

It doesn't make sense that `keystone-coverage-db` is in the
post queue since the only time it would be looked at is after
the patch merges.  This patch moves it to the check queue.

Change-Id: I6b91e2e8817998b3955738b74585b7978375a0d5

subject: Remove libnspr4-dev and nspr-devel
revisions:

Since change Ie38deadf190db33863c99d4610157349484ac10f ceilometer does
not use spidermonkey which needed libnspr4-dev (nspr-devel on Red Hat
systems) to be installed. There's
also no other repository using the library.

Thus the requirement can be removed now.

Change-Id: I51bd46a9ea747c1b886a6232653eab616300d4f4
"}]
commit_message:
Remove libnspr4-dev and nspr-devel

Since change Ie38deadf190db33863c99d4610157349484ac10f ceilometer does
not use spidermonkey which needed libnspr4-dev (nspr-devel on Red Hat
systems) to be installed. There's
also no other repository using the library.

Thus the requirement can be removed now.

Change-Id: I51bd46a9ea747c1b886a6232653eab616300d4f4

commit_message:
Clean deprecations from old "alarm" group

These options were inherited from ceilometer and for compatibility,
they have been marked being deprecated in group "alarm". We are in Aodh
3.0 now, it is time to remove them.

Change-Id: I41ef467750a403841ad96bfa7607ad63bd55702d

commit_message:
Build fuel-library as deb package

Package upstream and fuel-library Puppet modules for Ubuntu
using the current fuel-library RPM approach:

* use librarian-puppet-simple for downloading upstream modules
* use upstream_modules.tar.gz workaround to build package in
  isolated environments (LP #1482667)

Closes-Bug: #1535881
Change-Id: I176593263501093a2ce5e609f23a28d611f853a6

commit_message:
Fix missing swift noop tests

This change fixes the file names for the swift tasks that were created
as part of the openstack::swift::* class refactor. This change also adds
a test for the swift task that now include the proxy and storage code
for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I7da80d5f4976586e0712714b0fca7b5666b82f0c
Related-Bug: #1561890

subject: Support InsecureRequestWarning == None
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 19:10:02.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Support InsecureRequestWarning == None

According to requestsexceptions implementation, InsecureRequestWarning
can reference a class or None. When InsecureRequestWarning is None,
OpenStackCloud.__init__ crashs because warnings.filterwarnings expects
a class not None as category.

This change updates shade code to support this case.

Change-Id: Iad757400e15ed6b87db267bdc522aabce9aee8c9
'}]
commit_message:
Support InsecureRequestWarning == None

According to requestsexceptions implementation, InsecureRequestWarning
can reference a class or None. When InsecureRequestWarning is None,
OpenStackCloud.__init__ crashs because warnings.filterwarnings expects
a class not None as category.

This change updates shade code to support this case.

Change-Id: Iad757400e15ed6b87db267bdc522aabce9aee8c9

commit_message:
Provide valid UUID to oslo_vesionedobject

According to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html
using an invalid UUIDField will no longer be supported, so does the
warning messages for test_base.

Change-Id: I0a2b8cef5f9f42698897fb0b44aa84d732ca8cf0

commit_message:
Add posibility to configure Glance backend settings for Glare service

This patch adds posibility to configure backend settings for Glare
service.

Since Glare service is experimental feature, it can be usually disabled
for deployment. Hence was added a optional parameter 'glare_enabled' for
each backend manifest. So, if Glare is enabled glance glare config
will (and should) have same backend options as main glance api config.

Change-Id: I112a332f490d2e57eef5fa7d41d465c0eb89da04
Related-bug: #1555697

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-03-29 04:37:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': "SG protocol validation to allow numbers or names

SG rule protocol provided is validated against the DB rules'
protocols for both number and name. The filter provided to DB
is modified so that it is queried for records with both the
protocol name and number, instead of exactly the type provided
with the input. The returned DB rule record's protocol field is
validated against the supplied SG protocol field for both name
or number.
This way, user is still allowed to enter protocol name or number
to create a rule, and API compatibility is maintained.

Change-Id: If4ad684e961433b8d9d3ec8fe2810585d3f6a093
Closes-Bug: #1215181
"}]
commit_message:
SG protocol validation to allow numbers or names

SG rule protocol provided is validated against the DB rules'
protocols for both number and name. The filter provided to DB
is modified so that it is queried for records with both the
protocol name and number, instead of exactly the type provided
with the input. The returned DB rule record's protocol field is
validated against the supplied SG protocol field for both name
or number.
This way, user is still allowed to enter protocol name or number
to create a rule, and API compatibility is maintained.

Change-Id: If4ad684e961433b8d9d3ec8fe2810585d3f6a093
Closes-Bug: #1215181

subject: Mark resources UPDATE_COMPLETE when they request replacement
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 20:27:19.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Mark resources UPDATE_COMPLETE when they request replacement

When a resource plugin requests for a resource to be replaced (e.g. by
raising UpdateReplace in handle_update()), mark the resource as
UPDATE_COMPLETE with the reason, instead of leaving it as
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: I966b04908e6739bbadadeb20ba94ca8322c95f7d
Closes-Bug: #1560688
'}]
commit_message:
Mark resources UPDATE_COMPLETE when they request replacement

When a resource plugin requests for a resource to be replaced (e.g. by
raising UpdateReplace in handle_update()), mark the resource as
UPDATE_COMPLETE with the reason, instead of leaving it as
UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: I966b04908e6739bbadadeb20ba94ca8322c95f7d
Closes-Bug: #1560688

subject: Update build-image.sh for new images, add EXTRA_ELEMENTS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 23:22:26.000000000', 'files': ['tools/build-image.sh'], 'message': "Update build-image.sh for new images, add EXTRA_ELEMENTS

This changes the base element for build-image.sh to ubuntu-minimal, and
adds the simple-init element, to make this match the images used in the
gate.

It also adds an EXTRA_ELEMENTS environment variable that users can use
to add elements to the image. For example, local-config is useful to put
the current user's ssh keys in the image.

Last, it documents the things I needed to install to get it to run
correctly on Ubuntu; this is likely not an exhaustive list.

Change-Id: I2506c6722b77bb2f861d08e7a6da453dc2bbbfc2
"}]
commit_message:
Update build-image.sh for new images, add EXTRA_ELEMENTS

This changes the base element for build-image.sh to ubuntu-minimal, and
adds the simple-init element, to make this match the images used in the
gate.

It also adds an EXTRA_ELEMENTS environment variable that users can use
to add elements to the image. For example, local-config is useful to put
the current user's ssh keys in the image.

Last, it documents the things I needed to install to get it to run
correctly on Ubuntu; this is likely not an exhaustive list.

Change-Id: I2506c6722b77bb2f861d08e7a6da453dc2bbbfc2

subject: Fix permissions on /etc/nginx/sites-enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 19:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/mitaka.rst', 'diskimage-builder/elements/nginx/element-deps', 'diskimage-builder/elements/nginx/post-install.d/99-set-nginx-sites-enabled'], 'message': 'Fix permissions on /etc/nginx/sites-enabled

With the switch to rootwrap, the API service now runs as the gunicorn
user but /etc/nginx/sites-enabled is still owned by root.  This updates
the DIB element to ensure its writable by gunicorn for config rendering.

Also makes a trivial update to releasenotes to remove the UNRELEASED
flag from mitaka.

Change-Id: Ieac128e47a44dd48acd00f68cd8e3a9ca15441ec
Closes-bug: #1558577
'}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions on /etc/nginx/sites-enabled

With the switch to rootwrap, the API service now runs as the gunicorn
user but /etc/nginx/sites-enabled is still owned by root.  This updates
the DIB element to ensure its writable by gunicorn for config rendering.

Also makes a trivial update to releasenotes to remove the UNRELEASED
flag from mitaka.

Change-Id: Ieac128e47a44dd48acd00f68cd8e3a9ca15441ec
Closes-bug: #1558577

With snapshot backup, exceptions about Snapshot will
be raised.

This patch is to add handler about SnapshotNotFound
and InvalidSnapshot.

APIImpact
This bug is changes return code of creating backup request
when snapshot doesn't exist or is invalid.

Change-Id: Ib6a80df5496f93fb8967ed01e40d214c0c38aabc
Closes-Bug: #1549658
"}]
commit_message:
Handle exceptions about snapshot in backup create

With snapshot backup, exceptions about Snapshot will
be raised.

This patch is to add handler about SnapshotNotFound
and InvalidSnapshot.

APIImpact
This bug is changes return code of creating backup request
when snapshot doesn't exist or is invalid.

Change-Id: Ib6a80df5496f93fb8967ed01e40d214c0c38aabc
Closes-Bug: #1549658

revisions:
[{'number': 35, 'created': '2016-03-28 22:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Populate instance_mappings during boot

We need to start populating the mappings of instance to cells. For now a
mapping with a null cell_mapping will indicate that the instance has not
yet been scheduled and that list/show requests should be honored using
the persisted RequestSpec/BuildRequest. That work will be a followup to
this one.

There's no need to leave instance_mappings loitering in the database if
there are no cells yet. So if a scheduled host does not belong to a cell
the instance_mapping will be removed. The instance will be mapped later
as part of the migration process to cellsv2.

Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Change-Id: I6f02e966d2cef85f98b4b64aedd8c352387af15d
"}]
commit_message:
Populate instance_mappings during boot

We need to start populating the mappings of instance to cells. For now a
mapping with a null cell_mapping will indicate that the instance has not
yet been scheduled and that list/show requests should be honored using
the persisted RequestSpec/BuildRequest. That work will be a followup to
this one.

There's no need to leave instance_mappings loitering in the database if
there are no cells yet. So if a scheduled host does not belong to a cell
the instance_mapping will be removed. The instance will be mapped later
as part of the migration process to cellsv2.

Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Change-Id: I6f02e966d2cef85f98b4b64aedd8c352387af15d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-24 10:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_api_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add osapi_max_limit parameter

osapi_max_limit makes tunable the number of objects returned by
a single API call.

This is useful in large installations where tenants are likely
to have more than 1000 snapshots.

backup scripts that rely on:
existing_snapshots = cinder.volume_snapshots.list(search_opts=opts)
may have false negatives because the result is truncated to the
default value of 1000 items.

Change-Id: Id16eadb5d71d1d313399e638be948d79190bde6a
'}]
commit_message:
Add osapi_max_limit parameter

osapi_max_limit makes tunable the number of objects returned by
a single API call.

This is useful in large installations where tenants are likely
to have more than 1000 snapshots.

backup scripts that rely on:
existing_snapshots = cinder.volume_snapshots.list(search_opts=opts)
may have false negatives because the result is truncated to the
default value of 1000 items.

Change-Id: Id16eadb5d71d1d313399e638be948d79190bde6a

subject: Make service certificate come from explicit input
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-21 09:05:04.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Make service certificate come from explicit input

Even though the current way the service certificate is being passed to
the ControllerConfig is working. It's not the recommended way of doing
so. The recommended way is to use an input, and then the hieradata
field will get that input via Heat's get_input function. So this
commits adds that.

Change-Id: Iaf178622b77314e941903eaf071732340c05b8f0
Depends-On: I4943c6c74e0be96c1d7e190908b9262df05d059a
"}]
commit_message:
Make service certificate come from explicit input

Even though the current way the service certificate is being passed to
the ControllerConfig is working. It's not the recommended way of doing
so. The recommended way is to use an input, and then the hieradata
field will get that input via Heat's get_input function. So this
commits adds that.

Change-Id: Iaf178622b77314e941903eaf071732340c05b8f0
Depends-On: I4943c6c74e0be96c1d7e190908b9262df05d059a

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-28 21:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cover.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add `patch_cover` to keystone

`patch_cover` checks to make sure your patch has
adequate test coverage.

How it works is it stashes your changes, runs `tox -e cover`,
saves the results then stash pops your change and runs cover
again.  It then reports to show if your code in your patch
has 100% test coverage or not.

The intent of this job is to be a non-voting / warning like
job that can inform reviewers if the review clearly needs
more testing.

Since cover.sh is copied from [0] the copyright should
reflect the owners of the code.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/tests/ci/cover.sh

Change-Id: I66572072aa4d9563b6e1f73a8f8b3437116ef3c4
'}]
commit_message:
Add `patch_cover` to keystone

`patch_cover` checks to make sure your patch has
adequate test coverage.

How it works is it stashes your changes, runs `tox -e cover`,
saves the results then stash pops your change and runs cover
again.  It then reports to show if your code in your patch
has 100% test coverage or not.

The intent of this job is to be a non-voting / warning like
job that can inform reviewers if the review clearly needs
more testing.

Since cover.sh is copied from [0] the copyright should
reflect the owners of the code.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/master/tests/ci/cover.sh

Change-Id: I66572072aa4d9563b6e1f73a8f8b3437116ef3c4

A provider network will be created instead of the default private network.
In a multi node set up, user still need to add the physical interface to

Change-Id: I74bc673e99fcc18fa2ecdf903d80cb1b6e57250a

commit_message:
Add Provider Network enabling for devstack

This change allow users to enable provider network when they use devstack.
A provider network will be created instead of the default private network.
In a multi node set up, user still need to add the physical interface to
provider bridge by hand.

Change-Id: I74bc673e99fcc18fa2ecdf903d80cb1b6e57250a

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-18 14:56:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py', 'releasenotes/notes/vhost-user-mtu-23d0af36a8adfa56.yaml', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_vif.py'], 'message': 'stop setting mtu when plugging vhost-user ports

vhost-user is a userspace protocol to establish connectivity
between a virto-net frontend typically qemu and a
userspace virtio backend such as ovs with dpdk.

vhost-user interfaces exist only in userspace from the host perspective
and are not represented in the linux networking stack as kernel netdevs.
As a result attempting to set the mtu on a vhost-user interface
using ifconfig or ip link will fail with a device not found error.

- this change removes a call to _set_device_mtu when plugging
  vhost-user interfaces.
- this change prevents the device not found error from occurring
  which stopped vms booting with vhost-user interfaces

  an atomic action.

Change-Id: I2e17723d5052d57cd1557bd8a173c06ea0dcb2d4
Closes-Bug: #1533876
'}]
commit_message:
stop setting mtu when plugging vhost-user ports

vhost-user is a userspace protocol to establish connectivity
between a virto-net frontend typically qemu and a
userspace virtio backend such as ovs with dpdk.

vhost-user interfaces exist only in userspace from the host perspective
and are not represented in the linux networking stack as kernel netdevs.
As a result attempting to set the mtu on a vhost-user interface
using ifconfig or ip link will fail with a device not found error.

- this change removes a call to _set_device_mtu when plugging
  vhost-user interfaces.
- this change prevents the device not found error from occurring
  which stopped vms booting with vhost-user interfaces
  due to an uncaught exception resulting in a failure to set the
  interface type in ovs.
- this change make creating vhost-user interface
  an atomic action.

This latent bug is only triggered when the mtu value is set to a
value other than 0 which was the default proir to mitaka.

Change-Id: I2e17723d5052d57cd1557bd8a173c06ea0dcb2d4
Closes-Bug: #1533876

When dvr serviceable port is deleted/migrated, dvr callback checks

To prevent snat namespace removal we need to check SNAT bindings

commit_message:
Do not remove router from dvr_snat agents on dvr port deletion

When dvr serviceable port is deleted/migrated, dvr callback checks
if there are any more dvr serviceable ports on the host and if
there are no - removes the router from the agent on that host.
To prevent snat namespace removal we need to check SNAT bindings
and not remove router from l3 agent hosting SNAT.

testcase test_dvr_deletens_if_no_ports_no_removeable_routers
was removed because this change renders it invalid.

See patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/296851/

Closes-Bug: #1524908
Change-Id: I8c76bccdf495702e4c550df2eadec93c63e32120
(cherry picked from commit 521e1c9face737a8d432be16ad63829aaf21384e)

commit_message:
Fix bugs in functional tests

- Dont cache management address of appliances
- Wait for nova instance status==active before asserting router status
- Wait a full config_timeout (600s) for rebuild
- Also look for ha router interfaces when cleaning up

Change-Id: I69341c6abee4e36b10f8e9b676587babe861f0c0

commit_message:
Add 169.254.169.254 when enable force_metadata

When enable force_metadata in dhcp.ini, and create a network
and a subnet, none 169.254.169.254/24 ip info set in related
namespace(qdhcp-XXX) with `ip a` command. In this case, vms could
not get metadata any more.

Change-Id: Ib5b95f3afc6e66f66cdb7e1e98e5450a6e80a1b2
Closes-Bug: #1549793

aa

Change-Id: I58165c5618d2dcbc7d8a16b8370912a1a9f6142c

subject: Reset oslo.config upper-constraints to Liberty GA levels
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-08 14:57:58.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Reset oslo.config upper-constraints to Liberty GA levels

I97f0cf78bf2c980628abe0f18aa9f5e96af70ae7 stopped the bot from
proposing generated updates to the constraints file. Before that,
two bot proposed updates were landed in stable/liberty which made
upper-constraints diverge from what was released with the liberty GA
and are causing some problems with packages being able to install
together from minimum liberty versions and upper-constraints using
versions that come from mitaka.

This change specifically resets the oslo.config version (and
dependencies, but not transitive dependencies) in upper-constraints to
that of the liberty GA (based on commit
1cc88e0d007acb49d4fa2f7633ed1302b6d2bd4a which was the last commit
before the bot proposed updates were merged).

This should resolve an issue where the oslo.config job
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config fails on stable/liberty
because it's installing oslo.config from source which results in
version 2.4.1.dev3.

  ContextualVersionConflict:
    (oslo.config 2.4.1.dev3 (/opt/stack/new/oslo.config),
      Requirement.parse('oslo.config>=2.7.0'),
      set(['python-keystoneclient',
           'oslo.policy',
           'oslo.middleware',
           'oslo.log',
           'keystonemiddleware',
           'oslo.db',
           'pycadf',
           'oslo.concurrency']))

Derived from: I6da4f680d93b67ee7b7062dbec098170e2f6e240
Unblocks: If1130d0415cea53e83945af077c167152710bacb

Change-Id: I121b8b53cecc85d9e1a511a0d673e8f0a3cc24d8
"}]
commit_message:
Reset oslo.config upper-constraints to Liberty GA levels

I97f0cf78bf2c980628abe0f18aa9f5e96af70ae7 stopped the bot from
proposing generated updates to the constraints file. Before that,
two bot proposed updates were landed in stable/liberty which made
upper-constraints diverge from what was released with the liberty GA
and are causing some problems with packages being able to install
together from minimum liberty versions and upper-constraints using
versions that come from mitaka.

This change specifically resets the oslo.config version (and
dependencies, but not transitive dependencies) in upper-constraints to
that of the liberty GA (based on commit
1cc88e0d007acb49d4fa2f7633ed1302b6d2bd4a which was the last commit
before the bot proposed updates were merged).

This should resolve an issue where the oslo.config job
gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-oslo.config fails on stable/liberty
because it's installing oslo.config from source which results in
version 2.4.1.dev3.

  ContextualVersionConflict:
    (oslo.config 2.4.1.dev3 (/opt/stack/new/oslo.config),
      Requirement.parse('oslo.config>=2.7.0'),
      set(['python-keystoneclient',
           'oslo.policy',
           'oslo.middleware',
           'oslo.log',
           'keystonemiddleware',
           'oslo.db',
           'pycadf',
           'oslo.concurrency']))

Derived from: I6da4f680d93b67ee7b7062dbec098170e2f6e240
Unblocks: If1130d0415cea53e83945af077c167152710bacb

Change-Id: I121b8b53cecc85d9e1a511a0d673e8f0a3cc24d8

commit_message:
Cap Routes < 2.3

Routes 2.3 was released today and it breaks neutron on kilo. This
commit caps it so we avoid pulling it in.

Change-Id: Icae2266a66afa53e941254d5fc212fa2536178df

commit_message:
Support OS_PROJECT_NAME as well as OS_TENANT_NAME in the CLI

OS_PROJECT_NAME is now preferred throughout most if not all
of OpenStack projects at this point. OS_TENANT_NAME support remains
for backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I06d4af6538052ba3f63bb9f69998b1ac817f9ef5

commit_message:
Make OVS agent tunnel configuration logging less scary

The current log implies that something is wrong, most of the
time that's not the case.

subject: Fix regression handling relative paths in environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 20:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/template_utils.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/test_template_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix regression handling relative paths in environment

7627e1bae53747e1471caf632dfc1b6edf2e26cf introduced new code to add the
environment to the files mapping, so server side resolution of multiple
environments is possible.

However, the environment added is wrong when you're handling those with
relative paths inside, we must add the resolved version or the keys
don't map to keys in the files map, an you get an error when we try
to locate the file on the server.

Evidently we lack adequate functional test coverage of this, which can
be addressed via a heat patch, but I added a unit test illustrating
the problem.

Change-Id: I3bd2cd48623e4ad1b4067f4cefc7ddff30b9e88d
Closes-Bug: #1560106
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regression handling relative paths in environment

7627e1bae53747e1471caf632dfc1b6edf2e26cf introduced new code to add the
environment to the files mapping, so server side resolution of multiple
environments is possible.

However, the environment added is wrong when you're handling those with
relative paths inside, we must add the resolved version or the keys
don't map to keys in the files map, an you get an error when we try
to locate the file on the server.

Evidently we lack adequate functional test coverage of this, which can
be addressed via a heat patch, but I added a unit test illustrating
the problem.

Change-Id: I3bd2cd48623e4ad1b4067f4cefc7ddff30b9e88d
Closes-Bug: #1560106

commit_message:
Updates all repo SHAs to prepare for Mitaka release

This patch includes updates of all SHA's and pip, wheel and setuptools
pins.

Due to Bug #1561947, the backend glance store has been changed from swift
to file in the AIO gate. This has been done becuase the glance store project
has an issue with session that causes it to be incompatible with swift. Being
that the master integration gate is depending on this change to go it is
needed to temporarily disable the swift image store in glance until this issue
is fixed.

The branch updater sciprt was modified to search for and update roles if they're
found within the default or user provided role path. This change is resolving
bash errors that happen when the script is run in mitaka+.

Related-Bug: 1561947
Change-Id: I2e09e3e0abb61f5e97e2af7b283f0aed6dadd853
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: [WIP] Test to see if this fixes the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-29 00:07:14.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/kolla-toolbox/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': '[WIP] Test to see if this fixes the gate

python-setuptools is imported by the jinja2 module.  This is problematic
for from source builds, as two copies of setuptools end up being installed.

Another option is just to remove setuptools.

jinja2 is required I believe by the zookeeper integration.

Change-Id: I37c2ebc6bd0921f81d65a3eb03f9e8ed5ff8b030
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Test to see if this fixes the gate

python-setuptools is imported by the jinja2 module.  This is problematic
for from source builds, as two copies of setuptools end up being installed.

Another option is just to remove setuptools.

jinja2 is required I believe by the zookeeper integration.

Change-Id: I37c2ebc6bd0921f81d65a3eb03f9e8ed5ff8b030

Closes-Bug: #1553730

commit_message:
Scrub residual device before connect volume in cinder

Scrub residual device paths, sd devices and multipath device shells before
connect volume in cinder:
1.Scrub the devices in the host that with same iqns and luns of target;
2.Scrub /dev/sd* which belong to multipath device but not in /dev/disk/by_path;
3.Scrub multipath devices shell.

Change-Id: Ia7cd240f4640326d083bfa261242e53cfb620287
Closes-Bug: #1553730

commit_message:
Docs cleanup: volume command help

This formats the volume command help text consistent with the rest of OSC,
adds some reference targets and some explanation text to some commands.

No functional changes have been made, only cosmetic/help output.

Change-Id: Ib86ec3ca58bdea5f33078ced3ec3583b2be0e89a

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 9970, 'name': 'John Kasperski', 'email': 'jckasper@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'jckasper'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-26 03:03:42.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy', 'rejoin-stack.sh'], 'message': 'Neutron: Add rejoin_neutron function

When using Neutron, L3 agent, and OpenVSwitch, the IP address is moved
from the physical interface, ethX, over to the OVS bridge, br-ex. This
is done by ./stack.sh during the neutron L3 configuration.  This
movement is required in order to maintain connectivity to this IP
address.

When the host machine is rebooted OR the network service is restarted,
the IP address is associated with the physical interface, ethX, once
again and the IP address is no longer reachable.

Update rejoin-stack.sh to move the IP address (if necessary) using
the same logic that is invoked during stack.sh

Closes-Bug: #1521790
Change-Id: I0c80bb79c2bd1b5098f6dda0803798fed9d13463
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Add rejoin_neutron function

When using Neutron, L3 agent, and OpenVSwitch, the IP address is moved
from the physical interface, ethX, over to the OVS bridge, br-ex. This
is done by ./stack.sh during the neutron L3 configuration.  This
movement is required in order to maintain connectivity to this IP
address.

When the host machine is rebooted OR the network service is restarted,
the IP address is associated with the physical interface, ethX, once
again and the IP address is no longer reachable.

Update rejoin-stack.sh to move the IP address (if necessary) using
the same logic that is invoked during stack.sh

Closes-Bug: #1521790
Change-Id: I0c80bb79c2bd1b5098f6dda0803798fed9d13463

commit_message:
Don't merge: Replace duplicated code by iotop lib

This is for making sure the possiblity if we can replace the code
looks like duplicated with GPL liscenced kernel code.

This is only to try to replace iotop related but not yet for nice.
So still WIP and don't merge right now.

Change-Id: Ie1af9dfa3c4efeccd2e11b9f600ea95a3d5bc249

[{'number': 33, 'created': '2016-02-15 21:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/mech_driver/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mechanism_logger.py', 'releasenotes/notes/physical_network-aware-dhcp-scheduling-94e9fadc7c7c5fec.yaml', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/driver_api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/common/helpers.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mechanism_test.py', 'neutron/scheduler/dhcp_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Make DHCP agent scheduler physical_network aware

Currently neutron DCHP scheduler assumes that that every server running
a dhcp-agent can reach every network. Typically the scheduler can
wrongly schedule a vlan network on a dhcp-agent that has no reachability
to the network it's supposed to serve (ex: network's physical_network
not supported).

Typically such usecase can append if:

* physical_networks are dedicated to a specific service and we don't
  want to mix dnsmasqs related to different services (for
  isolation/configuration purpose),
* physical_networks are dedicated to a specific rack (see example
  diagram http://i.imgur.com/NTBxRxk.png), the rack interconnection can
  be handled outside of neutron or inside when routed-networks will be
  supported.

This change makes the DHCP scheduler network reachability aware by
querying plugin's filter_hosts_with_network_access method.

This change provides an implementation for ML2 plugin delegating host
filtering to its mechanism drivers: it aggregates the filtering done by
each mechanism or disables filtering if any mechanism doesn't overload
default mechanism implementation[1] (for backward compatibility with
out-of-tree mechanisms). Every in-tree mechanism overloads the default
implementation: OVS/LB/SRIOV mechanisms use their agent mapping to filter
hosts, l2pop/test/logger ones return empty set (they provide to "L2
capability").

This change provides a default implementation[2] for other plugins
filtering nothing (for backward compatibility), they can overload it to
provide their own implementation.

Such host filtering has some limitations if a dhcp-agent is on a host
handled by multiple l2 mechanisms with one mechanism claiming network
reachability but not the one handling dhcp-agent ports. Indeed the
host is able to reach the network but not dhcp-agent ports! Such
limitation will be handled in a follow-up change using host+vif_type
filtering.

[1] neutron.plugin.ml2.driver_api.MechanismDriver.\
      filter_hosts_with_network_access
[2] neutron.db.agents_db.AgentDbMixin.filter_hosts_with_network_access

Closes-Bug: #1478100
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0501d47404c8adbec4bccb84ac5980e045da68b3
'}]
commit_message:
Make DHCP agent scheduler physical_network aware

Currently neutron DCHP scheduler assumes that that every server running
a dhcp-agent can reach every network. Typically the scheduler can
wrongly schedule a vlan network on a dhcp-agent that has no reachability
to the network it's supposed to serve (ex: network's physical_network
not supported).

Typically such usecase can append if:

* physical_networks are dedicated to a specific service and we don't
  want to mix dnsmasqs related to different services (for
  isolation/configuration purpose),
* physical_networks are dedicated to a specific rack (see example
  diagram http://i.imgur.com/NTBxRxk.png), the rack interconnection can
  be handled outside of neutron or inside when routed-networks will be
  supported.

This change makes the DHCP scheduler network reachability aware by
querying plugin's filter_hosts_with_network_access method.

This change provides an implementation for ML2 plugin delegating host
filtering to its mechanism drivers: it aggregates the filtering done by
each mechanism or disables filtering if any mechanism doesn't overload
default mechanism implementation[1] (for backward compatibility with
out-of-tree mechanisms). Every in-tree mechanism overloads the default
implementation: OVS/LB/SRIOV mechanisms use their agent mapping to filter
hosts, l2pop/test/logger ones return empty set (they provide to "L2
capability").

This change provides a default implementation[2] for other plugins
filtering nothing (for backward compatibility), they can overload it to
provide their own implementation.

Such host filtering has some limitations if a dhcp-agent is on a host
handled by multiple l2 mechanisms with one mechanism claiming network
reachability but not the one handling dhcp-agent ports. Indeed the
host is able to reach the network but not dhcp-agent ports! Such
limitation will be handled in a follow-up change using host+vif_type
filtering.

[1] neutron.plugin.ml2.driver_api.MechanismDriver.\
      filter_hosts_with_network_access
[2] neutron.db.agents_db.AgentDbMixin.filter_hosts_with_network_access

Closes-Bug: #1478100
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Brandily <zzelle@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0501d47404c8adbec4bccb84ac5980e045da68b3

commit_message:
OSC plugin for orchestration template validate

This change implements "openstack orchestration template validate" command
Based from the existing heat commands:
   heat template-validate

This is different from the stack create/update --dry-run
which used the preview api, this uses the validate api.

Change-Id: Icf5794ad6bb35574a060f095d7ef10e6a46ca2fe
Blueprint: heat-support-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Wait longer for AMT firmware from deep sleep

Reuse options [amt]max_attempts and [amt]action_wait to
control the wait time to wake up AMT firmware.
This will try to wake up AMT firmware three times and wait 10s
before next wake up call by default.

Closes-Bug: #1504023
Change-Id: I45baa502dea41d43e48c4268f5f5b47f69407dfe

Functional: use pined magnum client

so always use latesed code of magnum cient may break them.

commit_message:
Remove NodeNotOrphan exception type

The NodeNotOrphan exception is not interesting at all. It is basically
one type of bad request. This patch proposes a removal of it.

Change-Id: I008251ef6ffc50677bc62cdbbe00483f5ff88b14

commit_message:
Refactor API version range support

This patch refactors the API version check so that the min/max versions
are defined only for OpenStack APIs. Previously, these definitions are
placed in a global scope which is incorrect.

commit_message:
Implement multisite VIM feature

Added support for multisite OpenStack VIM feature through a new
'nfvo' extension. This also enables remote VNF life cycle manage-
ment through the VIM Id parameter.

Implements: blueprint multi-site-vim
Depends-On: I3c08945f24343288c2c5614ab4b472d68a1e1d47

Change-Id: I7dd19a0c1ce948474bb3069073b3608ce265beb4

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-07 09:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Block subtractive operations in DB migrations

To achieve rolling upgrades we need to make non-backward-compatible DB schema
migrations in a very specific manner that spans through 3 releases. In
particular we need to be very careful when dropping or altering columns
and tables.

This commit adds a test that blocks all the ALTER and DROP operations
from DB migrations. It allows to specify exceptions from this rule for two
purposes:
* Some DROP/ALTER migrations aren't subtractive (e.g. dropping a
  constraint).
* When following the process we've designed for non-backward-compatible
  migrations, we should be able to drop first unused columns or tables
  in O release.

The test is based on similar one implemented in Nova.

Implements: bp online-schema-upgrades

Change-Id: I07df721e5505abe17e45427c05b985b7e923a010
"}]
commit_message:
Block subtractive operations in DB migrations

To achieve rolling upgrades we need to make non-backward-compatible DB schema
migrations in a very specific manner that spans through 3 releases. In
particular we need to be very careful when dropping or altering columns
and tables.

This commit adds a test that blocks all the ALTER and DROP operations
from DB migrations. It allows to specify exceptions from this rule for two
purposes:
* Some DROP/ALTER migrations aren't subtractive (e.g. dropping a
  constraint).
* When following the process we've designed for non-backward-compatible
  migrations, we should be able to drop first unused columns or tables
  in O release.

The test is based on similar one implemented in Nova.

Implements: bp online-schema-upgrades

Change-Id: I07df721e5505abe17e45427c05b985b7e923a010

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-24 17:55:31.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': "firewall: don't warn about a driver that does not accept bridge

Drivers that do not need the bridge parameter are safe to ignore it.
Actually, the base abstract interface for those drivers does not allow
to pass the new parameter.

Ideally, the base class __init__ signature would change to accept the
argument, but we can't do it without breaking API.

So instead, just handle both types of drivers - those that accept the
additional argument, and those that don't. And don't assume the latter
are somehow wrong.

Change-Id: Iceee46f63669b28e3a34d207216d864f1bfa5cf8
Closes-Bug: #1561243
"}]
commit_message:
firewall: don't warn about a driver that does not accept bridge

Drivers that do not need the bridge parameter are safe to ignore it.
Actually, the base abstract interface for those drivers does not allow
to pass the new parameter.

Ideally, the base class __init__ signature would change to accept the
argument, but we can't do it without breaking API.

So instead, just handle both types of drivers - those that accept the
additional argument, and those that don't. And don't assume the latter
are somehow wrong.

Change-Id: Iceee46f63669b28e3a34d207216d864f1bfa5cf8
Closes-Bug: #1561243

commit_message:
Make network segment table available for standalone plugin

Some standalone plugins, such as networking-ovn, are expecting
to store provider network information in neutron database, but
we have no table, like other extensions do, for provider
network extension defined.

This patch moves NetworkSegment table out of the ML2 code tree.
The API methods to operate segments are also moved, but stub
methods are still kept in the ml2 db API.

Co-Author: Miguel Lavalle <malavall@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I2c4f78fce591486ded63252af13fc0c60d02a3e8
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

subject: Zero Downtime Re-indexing Error Handling.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-28 23:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/cmd/manage.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py'], 'message': 'Zero Downtime Re-indexing Error Handling.

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/zero-downtime-reindexing.html

The Zero Downtime code is deficient in the error handling department.
One cleanup method too few. If we get any unrecoverable exceptions
while creating/preparing the indexes or aliases, we cannot continue.
In this case we need to roll back and undo any changes we made.

Change-Id: I5591d5208f75015f93b8431e73d2d7c7f5f2e167
Closes-Bug: #1557003
(cherry picked from commit bc9eeaa9bac867eb28c07077fe7ee4cc4af9db5f)
'}]
commit_message:
Zero Downtime Re-indexing Error Handling.

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/zero-downtime-reindexing.html

The Zero Downtime code is deficient in the error handling department.
One cleanup method too few. If we get any unrecoverable exceptions
while creating/preparing the indexes or aliases, we cannot continue.
In this case we need to roll back and undo any changes we made.

Change-Id: I5591d5208f75015f93b8431e73d2d7c7f5f2e167
Closes-Bug: #1557003
(cherry picked from commit bc9eeaa9bac867eb28c07077fe7ee4cc4af9db5f)

commit_message:
make/update_subnetpool_dict call _dict_extend

Now the extension fields were not being added to the response for
subnetpool, and when update subnetpool, the response of updated was not
contain any extensions which based on 'standard_attr'.

This patch add 'call _extend_dict' functions to make subnetpool support
for extending dict.

Change-Id: I7bc449aa079d84869b2a707b36bbbfb22d540cc5
Closes-Bug: #1548161

commit_message:
Zero Downtime Re-indexing Error Handling.

See spec:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/searchlight-specs/specs/mitaka/zero-downtime-reindexing.html

The Zero Downtime code is deficient in the error handling department.
One cleanup method too few. If we get any unrecoverable exceptions
while creating/preparing the indexes or aliases, we cannot continue.
In this case we need to roll back and undo any changes we made.

Change-Id: I5591d5208f75015f93b8431e73d2d7c7f5f2e167
Closes-Bug: #1557003

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-03-11 23:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/effective_neutron.rst', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_common_db_mixin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py'], 'message': "L3HA: Do not wrap create/delete in transaction

This is unsafe when calling ML2 because ML2 assumes that its
functions will not be called inside of a transaction. This is
not only an issue for drivers that try to do DB lookups using
a different session in the post commit operation, but it's a
big issue for the delete methods.

The delete subnet and network methods in ML2 have 'while True'
loops that catch concurrency errors and retry the operation after
looking up info. If these are called inside a transaction, the
lookups will contain stale information and it can lead to the
while True loop never terminating!

Closes-Bug: #1551958
Change-Id: I33dc084ed15e5491fdda19da712a746ca87fbc8c
"}]
commit_message:
L3HA: Do not wrap create/delete in transaction

This is unsafe when calling ML2 because ML2 assumes that its
functions will not be called inside of a transaction. This is
not only an issue for drivers that try to do DB lookups using
a different session in the post commit operation, but it's a
big issue for the delete methods.

The delete subnet and network methods in ML2 have 'while True'
loops that catch concurrency errors and retry the operation after
looking up info. If these are called inside a transaction, the
lookups will contain stale information and it can lead to the
while True loop never terminating!

Closes-Bug: #1551958
Change-Id: I33dc084ed15e5491fdda19da712a746ca87fbc8c

Change-Id: If14b5afec201068af7cc6fc903cdf6fa72887c2a
'}]
commit_message:
Also package congress_tempest_tests

The folder congress_tempest_tests has to be packaged in order for the
Debian packaging CI to work. Otherwise, we get:
ImportError: No module named congress_tempest_tests.plugin
when running templest.

Please allow this distribution specific patch to reach upstream.

Change-Id: If14b5afec201068af7cc6fc903cdf6fa72887c2a

subject: WIP: Keep the console logs for all boots
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-17 16:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic', 'files/hooks/qemu'], 'message': "WIP: Keep the console logs for all boots

This patch adds a libvirt hook that saves the VM console log everytime
it shutdown. This is great for troubleshooting because it allow us to
see what happened with the VM on every boot instead of only the last one.

Devstack: Remove QEMU hook at ./unstack
Remove the libvirt QEMU hook to rotate the logs when ./unstack is
invoked. Otherwise it will always rotate the logs even if the
IRONIC_VM_LOG_ROTATE is set to False in a subsequently ran.

This commit also makes the path to the hook configurable.

Devstack: Make sure libvirt's hooks directory exists
Before copying the QEMU hook to the libvirt's hooks directory, make sure
that the path exists. Some distros do not create it by default (e.g
Fedora 23).

(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit 2f6dce97384718f6a35d1d9a12d3d1ae5128a271)
(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit d9a2a62ac009ac07ec1ebdb1626896b5bb592bc7)
(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit ac54456a8ed225512fd5702952a454675280db75)

Change-Id: Iba692d7ec761a79bd2bca8fb09df38461459f107
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Keep the console logs for all boots

This patch adds a libvirt hook that saves the VM console log everytime
it shutdown. This is great for troubleshooting because it allow us to
see what happened with the VM on every boot instead of only the last one.

Devstack: Remove QEMU hook at ./unstack
Remove the libvirt QEMU hook to rotate the logs when ./unstack is
invoked. Otherwise it will always rotate the logs even if the
IRONIC_VM_LOG_ROTATE is set to False in a subsequently ran.

This commit also makes the path to the hook configurable.

Devstack: Make sure libvirt's hooks directory exists
Before copying the QEMU hook to the libvirt's hooks directory, make sure
that the path exists. Some distros do not create it by default (e.g
Fedora 23).

(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit 2f6dce97384718f6a35d1d9a12d3d1ae5128a271)
(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit d9a2a62ac009ac07ec1ebdb1626896b5bb592bc7)
(cherry-picked from openstack/ironic commit ac54456a8ed225512fd5702952a454675280db75)

Change-Id: Iba692d7ec761a79bd2bca8fb09df38461459f107

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-12 14:20:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'doc/source/devref/service_extensions.rst', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Block delete_(network|subnet) transactioned calls

These functions assume that they won't be called inside of a
transaction for two reasons. The first is an infinite loop that
will only terminate if it can actually retrieve the latest
information from the database. The second is that ML2's post-commit
operations are expected to occur after data was actually committed
so mechanism drivers that do DB lookups using a different session
may break.

This adds an explicit guard that prevents these two functions from
being called within an active DB session. The rest of the ML2
functions should eventually be converted to this style as well
(see the partial bug).

Related-Bug: #1551958
Partial-Bug: #1540844
Change-Id: I5c00b186585369ef6c8e2b9cb5a43b8bba0e5a7c
"}]
commit_message:
Block delete_(network|subnet) transactioned calls

These functions assume that they won't be called inside of a
transaction for two reasons. The first is an infinite loop that
will only terminate if it can actually retrieve the latest
information from the database. The second is that ML2's post-commit
operations are expected to occur after data was actually committed
so mechanism drivers that do DB lookups using a different session
may break.

This adds an explicit guard that prevents these two functions from
being called within an active DB session. The rest of the ML2
functions should eventually be converted to this style as well
(see the partial bug).

Related-Bug: #1551958
Partial-Bug: #1540844
Change-Id: I5c00b186585369ef6c8e2b9cb5a43b8bba0e5a7c
